required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OCT Explores Vascular Response and Healing Profile After Stenting in CTO
clinical_study.official_title: Optical Coherence Tomography Imaging Explores Long-term vasculAR Response and Healing profIle After successFul coronarY Stenting in Chronic Total Occlusion

brief_summary.textblock: True-false-true occurred during wire penetration in coronary CTO procedure. Subintimal stenting influences vascular response. Intravenous ultrasound confirmed wire position in the procedure. Then stenting procedure was performed. Optical coherence tomography was used for exploring long-term vascular response and healing profile after successful coronary stenting in CTO lesions.

detailed_description.textblock: Chronic total occlusions (CTOs) are defined as coronary lesions with thrombolysis in myocardial infarction (TIMI) grade flow of 0 and present for more than 3 months. CTO is commonly recognized as the toughest lesion subset to be treated by percutaneous coronary interventions. With the remarkable progress in the technologies and techniques achieved in the PCI for CTO over the last decade, the rate of procedural success increased to 80-90%. Chronic total occlusion is associated with a higher incidence of malapposition and uncovered stent struts. At present, four strategies were used for CTO lesions, including: ante-grade wire escalation, ante-grade dissection reentry (ADR), retro-grade wire escalation, and retrograde dissection reentry (RDR). True-false-true occurred during wire penetration. Subintimal stenting influences vascular response. Intravenous ultrasound (IVUS) confirmed wire position in the procedure. Then stenting procedure was performed according to standard routine. Optical coherence tomography (OCT) was used for exploring long-term vascular response and healing profile after successful coronary stenting in CTO lesions.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All enrolled patients received optical coherence tomography examination after successful stening at the chronic total occlusion lesion.

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Total Occlusion of Coronary Artery

arm_group.description: Patients, whose coronary chronic total occlusion lesion was successfully implanted stent, received optical coherence tomography imaging immediately and at 9-12 months after index procedure.

intervention.description: Patients with coronary chronic total occlusion received successful stenting. Optimal coherence tomography imaged immediately and at 9-12 months after the index procedure to explore long-term vascular response and healing profile.
